name: Four Points by Sheraton Miami Beach

reviews.text: This hotel is a good value. THe lobby and other facilities are nice but our room was a little dated and the noise level from the halls was a bit loud at times. We had no problems with parking or elevators as noted in some of the other reviews.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and a good value.

reviews.text: One would think that after paying $217 per night at a Sheraton Hotel that I would only have pleasant things to say. This is not the place to be in Miami. First off the elevators are death traps. They are about 100 more rides away from somebody being hurt or seriously injured. Who would build a ten+ story building with only two elevators? Oh yeah and a service elevator which had mind of it's own. One day it stop at every floor without opening the doors till it reached the lower level. The next day it wouldn't even go to the lower level so we had to walk down from the fourth floor. Also, this hotel charges for everything: Roll away bed...$15/day. Breakfast bufett...$12/day. Valet Parking....$18/day. $.50 Hot dogs for $8 at the poolside...Priceless! The biggest surprise is that there is nothing near this place. The only business near here is Walgreens. No restaurants and a cab to south beach can run between 10 to 12 dollars. We walked to Walgreens one night and it look like a bad episode of 21 Jumpstreet. People were all on the corners hanging out in the front of the other hotels like gangs. We stayed here doing Memorial Day weekend and we all wished that we stayed at a nicer hotel closer to South Beach. Especially for $217 per night.
reviews.title: Not like Shaq's House!
Very nice hotel, employees went over and above
reviews.text: I do not not know why this hotel gets the ratings that it does, we stayed here on a family vacation for 7 days, the service was outstanding, frontdesk associates very helpful, and informative, rooms are very very clean, pool was fantastic, the hotel is just far enough from the intense action, which was nice to be able to take a break, the balcony rooms are outstanding. For the price you pay this hotel is very worth it and the associates are fantastic.

reviews.title: Not really a Sheraton
reviews.text: I forgot to give a review from our stay last summer. I hope this is helpful. We came to this Hotel because we are Starwood Members. We have stayed in Sheratons, Westons, W's and other Starwood properies over the years and have come to expect a certain level of luxury from this marque. We are well aware that a Sheraton is by no means to be compared to a W or Weston but we have found Sheratons all around the USA to be on a higher level. Atlanta and Nashville come to mind as exceptional Sheratons.

reviews.title: Don't Stay Here! Terrible . . .
reviews.text: The lobby area and pool area of this particular hotel were very nice. The beach was beautiful as well. We enjoyed walking along the boardwalk and taking in the sights.
Absolutely, positively a horrible experience.
reviews.title: Worst...hotel experience (in miami beach) ... Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't let the lobby deceive you. The hotel is trashed.
reviews.title: Horrible start, problems fixed later, but never again!

reviews.text: All of the passenger elevators were broken, forcing guests to share freight with employees. We were told no one available to fix them bc of holiday and weekend, which is BS. The truth is they simply didn't want to pay overtime/holiday rates for repairmen.
reviews.title: Beautiful location with reasonable rates

reviews.text: Vending machines on all floors empty, and according to hotel staff had been for weeks.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel Amidst the Construction

likes.liked: — It is by the beach and the boardwalk.

reviews.text: Recently my family and I stayed at the Four Points Sheraton in Miami Beach and were disgusted with the hotel and most of their staff. When we arrived in Miami and called for directions to the hotel no one could speak enough english to tell us how to get to the hotel. The first night of our stay we discovered that the walls we so thin that we could hear everything, and I do mean everything that the people on either side of us were doing. This became appearent when a fight broke out and the police were called. On the second night several rooms of very intoxicated girls began to have party in the hallway at 2am. We called the front desk and they asked which rooms the girls were in. We replied we didn't know. We called back a few minutes later when no security had arrived and it looked like the group of 20 was going to go down the elevators. The front desk informed us there was nothing they could do because they didn't know who was coming off the elevators. We called a third time that night when several males stood outside in the hallway having cell phone conversations. Security did come up this time, asked the men to take their conversations elsewhere, the men smarted off to the security and the security left. For two hours this went on till the night manager finally came up and told us that we might as well stop calling because the best anyone could do was get us a new room in the morning. The next morning when we went to the front desk we were not allowed to move and told that "this is Miami Beach it's a party." On the third and last night of our stay, a man began punching our door after a fight with someone in the hallway. We called the front desk who told us "what do you want us to do he'll be gone by the time we get up there." This hotel was awful. We travel a lot and have never had an experience this bad before in our life.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here!

reviews.text: We booked two nights at the Sheraton Four Ponts via Dial-A-Flight. Paying in advance for B&B.
reviews.title: unhelpful and condescending

reviews.text: Arrived at the "sheraton" after 13 hours of travel to be told they didn't have a room. We were bounced to their sister hotel which was very basic. I had to go into the hotel kitchen (no restaurant) to find something to eat - which ended up being toast. So our meal was toast and thick black coffee.
reviews.title: Not the greatest
One-Two Points Sheraton
reviews.text: We went back to the sheraton the next day, and we did get a good room for our second night.
We had dinner - poor but expensive for what we had.
reviews.title: More like the Two Points Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I am usually hesitant to stay at hotels with poor reviews, we must have lucked out, because our stay at the Sheraton Four Points in Miami was wonderful.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay; Beautiful Oceanview Room

likes.disliked: — The hotel was fine. There was nothing we disliked.

reviews.text: We requested an oceanview room, and was given one that looked directly onto the pool, the beach, and the Atlantic. The rosy sky over the deep blue ocean was astonishing to watch at sunrise.
reviews.title: Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the hotel staff were wonderful and very attentive. We had to request some small plumbing service and wanted some extra towels. The maintenance and housekeeping personnel came to our room very quickly. Although there is only valet parking, we didn't mind since there were in/out privileges and the valet parking staff were very nice.
reviews.title: ''be very aware - tourist trap''

reviews.text: The room service food was quite good. There is a 1/2 hour room service delivery guarantee, but the food came more quickly than that. The room service breakfasts were enormous and quite delicious.
reviews.title: Beware!

reviews.text: One of the elevators was not working, so there was a wait to get up and down the floors. Unfortunately, while we were waiting, we were subjected to some bigoted guests who were pointing to us and complaining about "you foreigners" (btw, we're good 'ole U.S. American) -- but I guess everyone is entitled to their viewpoint, right? We didn't let that ruin our otherwise very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: My experience was good!!

likes.liked: — Hotel is right on the beach. Rooms are very comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The parking situation and the elevators.

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Miami Beach Hotel
description: Welcome to the Four Points by Sheraton Miami Beach. We've kept the historical charm and protected Miami Modern exterior of the building in tact while we've updated the interiors for your comfort.
